paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.349G>T, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Shortness of breath, nocturnal asthma, nausea, vomiting, loss of appetite, urinary incontinence.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 64-year-old woman presented with a 3-year history of shortness of breath after activity, occasionally accompanied by nocturnal asthma...

individual_records.phenotype_details: Abdominal bloating, abnormal ECG, elevated NT-proBNP.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Some 18 months later, a 59-year-old man (the younger brother of Case 1) carried out a routine physical examination after presenting with a 1-week history of abdominal bloating...

functional_data.summary: The missense variant c.349G>T (p.Ala117Ser) of TTR may be responsible for the occurrence of ATTR in the family from southern China.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family as both siblings are affected.
variants.population_frequency: The mutation c.349G>T has mainly been reported in southern China.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on familial segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: The missense variant c.349G>T (p.Ala117Ser) of TTR may be responsible for the occurrence of ATTR in the family from southern China.
Genetic testing revealed that his mutation site was consistent with that of his older sister.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
